00014 /* $Id: dynarray.h 4932 2007-09-07 17:17:23Z bmribler $ */

00016 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00017  * File:    dynarray.h
00018  * Purpose: header file for dynamic array API
00019  * Dependencies: 
00020  * Invokes:
00021  * Contents:
00022  * Structure definitions: 
00023  * Constant definitions: 
00024  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00025 
00026 /* avoid re-inclusion */
00027 #ifndef __DYNARRAY_H
00028 #define __DYNARRAY_H
00029 
00030 #include "hdf.h"
00031 
00032 /*
00033     Define the pointer to the dynarray without giving outside routines access
00034     to the internal workings of the structure.
00035 */
00036 typedef struct dynarray_tag *dynarr_p;
00037 
00038 #if defined DYNARRAY_MASTER | defined DYNARRAY_TESTER
00039 typedef struct dynarray_tag 
00040   {
00041       intn num_elems;       /* Number of elements in the array currently */
00042       intn incr_mult;       /* Multiple to increment the array size by */
00043       VOIDP *arr;           /* Pointer to the actual array of void *'s */
00044   }dynarr_t;
00045 
00046 #endif /* DYNARRAY_MASTER | DYNARRAY_TESTER */
00047 
00048 #if defined c_plusplus || defined __cplusplus
00049 extern      "C"
00050 {
00051 #endif                          /* c_plusplus || __cplusplus */
00052 
00053 /******************************************************************************
00054  NAME
00055      DAcreate_array - Create a dynarray
00056 
00057  DESCRIPTION
00058     Create a dynarray for later use.  This routine allocates the dynarray
00059     structure and creates a dynarray with the specified minimum size.
00060 
00061  RETURNS
00062     Returns pointer to the dynarray created if successful and NULL otherwise
00063 
00064 *******************************************************************************/
00065 dynarr_p DAcreate_array(intn start_size,      /* IN: Initial array size */
00066     intn incr_mult                  /* IN: multiple to create additional elements in */
00067 );
00068 
00069 /******************************************************************************
00070  NAME
00071      DAdestroy_array - Destroy a dynarray
00072 
00073  DESCRIPTION
00074     Destroy an existing dynarray from use.  This routine de-allocates the
00075     dynarray structure and deletes the current dynarray.
00076 
00077  RETURNS
00078     Returns SUCCEED if successful and FAIL otherwise
00079 
00080 *******************************************************************************/
00081 intn DAdestroy_array(dynarr_p arr,  /* IN: Array to destroy */
00082         intn free_elem              /* IN: whether to free each element */
00083 );
00084 
00085 /******************************************************************************
00086  NAME
00087      DAdestroy_array - Get the current size of a dynarray
00088 
00089  DESCRIPTION
00090     Get the number of elements in use currently.
00091 
00092  RETURNS
00093     Returns # of dynarray elements if successful and FAIL otherwise
00094 
00095 *******************************************************************************/
00096 intn DAsize_array(dynarr_p arr   /* IN: Array to get size of */
00097 );
00098 
00099 /******************************************************************************
00100  NAME
00101      DAget_elem - Get an element from a dynarray
00102 
00103  DESCRIPTION
00104     Retrieve an element from a dynarray.  If the element to be retrieved is
00105     beyond the end of the currently allocated array elements, the array is
00106     not extended, a NULL pointer is merely returned.
00107 
00108  RETURNS
00109     Returns object ptr if successful and NULL otherwise
00110 
00111 *******************************************************************************/
00112 VOIDP DAget_elem(dynarr_p arr_ptr, /* IN: Array to access */
00113     intn elem                       /* IN: Array element to retrieve */
00114 );
00115 
00116 /******************************************************************************
00117  NAME
00118      DAset_elem - Set an element pointer for a dynarray
00119 
00120  DESCRIPTION
00121     Set an element pointer for a dynarray.  If the element to be set is
00122     beyond the end of the currently allocated array elements, the array is
00123     extended by whatever multiple of the incr_mult is needed to expand the
00124     # of array elements to include the array element to set.
00125 
00126  RETURNS
00127     Returns SUCCEED if successful and NULL otherwise
00128 
00129 *******************************************************************************/
00130 intn DAset_elem(dynarr_p arr_ptr,  /* IN: Array to access */
00131     intn elem,                      /* IN: Array element to set */
00132     VOIDP obj                       /* IN: Pointer to the object to store */
00133 );
00134 
00135 /*****************************************************************************
00136  NAME
00137      DAdel_elem - Delete an element from a dynarray
00138 
00139  DESCRIPTION
00140     Retrieve an element from a dynarray & delete it from the dynarray.  If the
00141     element to be retrieved is beyond the end of the currently allocated array
00142     elements, the array is not extended, a NULL pointer is merely returned.
00143 
00144  RETURNS
00145     Returns object ptr if successful and NULL otherwise
00146 
00147 *******************************************************************************/
00148 VOIDP DAdel_elem(dynarr_p arr_ptr, /* IN: Array to access */
00149     intn elem                       /* IN: Array element to retrieve */
00150 );
00151 
00152 #if defined c_plusplus || defined __cplusplus
00153 }
00154 #endif                          /* c_plusplus || __cplusplus */
00155 
00156 #endif /* __DYNARRAY_H */
00157
